snippet: The lawsuit, filed last year on behalf of six refugees, claimed that the school district in central New York shunted refugees who were older than 16 into inferior alternatives to high school.
abstract: Utica City School District in central New York State settles lawsuit over its treatment of refugee children, all over age 16 and non-English speaking, who were excluded from city's high school; agreement requires district to contact all school-age students documented by refugee advocacy group over past four years who are not enrolled in high school and inform them of their rights to attend school in New York.
lead_paragraph: The lawsuit, filed last year on behalf of six refugees, claimed that the school district in central New York shunted refugees who were older than 16 into inferior alternatives to high school.

headline.main: Utica Settles Lawsuit Over Refugees’ Access to High School
headline.print_headline: Utica Settles Suit on Refugee Access to School
